definition[0]: to cut through something completely, separating it into two parts, or to become cut in this way
example[0]: Martinâ€™s hand was severed in the accident.
definition[1]: to end a relationship with someone, or a connection with something, especially because of a disagreement
example[2]: The two countries severed diplomatic relations.
example[3]: She had severed all contact with her ex-husband.
explanation[0]: In everyday English, people usually say cut off rather than sever:
example[4]: The end of his finger had been cut off.
example[5]: The children's father had cut off all contact with them.
definition[2]: to end a business relationship or connection with someone because of a disagreement
example[6]: He hassevered all financial ties with his former firm.
example[7]: A business dispute caused the company and its distributor tosever relations.
